title: How to Make Chocolate Snowball Cookies

steps.headline: Cream the butter and sugar.
steps.description: To start, place your butter and sugar in a large a mixing bowl. Use a wooden spoon to gently mash the two together until you have a smooth, even consistency. This works best if you let your butter come to room temperature before you begin cooking.

steps.headline: Add the eggs and vanilla.
steps.description: From here, add the eggs and vanilla to your dough. Mix them in using a mixing spoon until the texture is smooth throughout. You may have to beat the eggs slightly to get them to mix with the rest of the dough.

steps.headline: Stir in the dry ingredients and pecans.
steps.description: Add the dry ingredients, which include the flour, salt, and cocoa powder gradually. If you add them too fast, they will be hard to mix into the dough. Once the dry ingredients are mixed in, add the pecans and gently stir them until they're mixed into the dough.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the dough for two hours.
steps.description: Cover the mixing bowl with aluminum foil or plastic wrap. Place the dough in a cleared out place in your refrigerator. Allow it to sit for 30 minutes. This will get the dough stiff enough to roll into balls.

steps.headline: Bake your cookies.
steps.description: To bake, roll the dough into one inch balls. Then, place the dough on an un-greased cookie sheet. Make sure to leave about half an inch of space between each cookie. Bake the cookies at  350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 minutes. When the cookies are done baking, transfer them to a cooling rack.

steps.headline: Roll in confectioner's sugar to decorate.
steps.description: Once the cookies are cool to the touch, place some confectioner's sugar in a bowl. Roll each cookie in the sugar until it's coated in sugar. You should be left with cookies in the shape of small, white balls.

steps.headline: Mix the almonds, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt in a small bowl.
steps.description: Use a wire whisk or fork to make sure everything is mixed together smoothly. These are your dry ingredients, which you will be adding to your dough later. Set them aside for now.

steps.headline: Cream the butter and brown sugar.
steps.description: Place the brown sugar and butter in a large mixing bowl. Use a wooden spoon to mash them together until they form a smooth, uniform texture. It's best to let your butter come to room temperature first.

steps.headline: Beat in the egg.
steps.description: Add your egg. Use a mixing spoon or wire whisk to beat it into the flour. Keep beating until the egg is completely mixed into the dough.

steps.headline: Add the the chocolates and dry ingredients.
steps.description: Mix in the cooled, melted chocolate into your dough. Then, add the dry ingredients. Stir everything together until it's all combined evenly.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the dough.
steps.description: Put plastic or aluminum foil over your mixing bowl. Place the bowl in the oven. Allow it to sit until the dough is firm. This will take around 10 to 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Coat the cookies in icing.
steps.description: Once the dough is hardened, place some of the icing sugar in a small bowl. Roll the cookies into one inch balls and coat them in sugar. Then, set them on a baking sheet.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies.
steps.description: Bake your cookies at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 12 to 14 minutes. Leave them on the cookie rack for two minutes before transferring them to a cooling rack. Allow them to cool to the touch before eating them.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven.
steps.description: You should preheat the oven to 350F/180/175C before you begin cooking. It's a good idea to use an oven thermometer, especially if you have a gas oven, to make sure that your oven is heated to the right temperature.

steps.headline: Blend your ingredients in a food processor.
steps.description: For this recipe, you will actually blend everything in a food processor until its smooth. You can also use a blender if you don't have a food processor. If you don't have a very big blender or food processor, you may have to blend half the ingredients and then the other half.

steps.headline: Roll the dough into balls.
steps.description: Once the dough is formed, roll it into balls. The balls should be about three inches. Make sure to wash your hands before and after handling the dough.

steps.headline: Roll the cookies in shredded coconut.
steps.description: Place your shredded coconut in a bowl. Roll each cookie in the coconut. Place the cookies on a baking tray, keeping them a few inches or centimeters apart.

steps.headline: Bake for 16 to 18 minutes.
steps.description: Your cookies will take about 16 to 18 minutes to bake. The coconut should be just golden brown when they are ready. Remove from the oven and leave them on the tray for 10 minutes before transferring them to a cooling rack.
